page.title: 08WAT TYLER COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The park is named after the leaders of the peasants Revolt. There are sheds and pillboxes left over from the two world wars. The site of the park was useful both to defend the oil refineries and attack the aeroplanes on their way to bomb {London. } The country park is on a site where there are many interesting,plants birds and animals.There is great variety of the types of landscape.eg saltmarshes,rivers,woodland and fields.Nature trails have been set up to allow people to learn about and enjoy these. Pitsea Creek was once important for shipping in the area. Now it is used as a marina for pleasure craft. There are however some interesting old boats there. The old light boat is reputedly {haunted}by its captain.
